description.p: A new version of Viper has been released, fixing a minor bug.
A new version of UFL has been released. This version fixes a minor bug for handling constants in forms.
A new version of UFC has been released. This version adds some minor tweaks for the installatioin of UFC.
A new version of Instant has been released.
A new version of FFC has been released, fixing a number of minor bugs.

A new version of DOLFIN has been released, fixing a large number of bugs and bringing many improvements. The most notable changes are improved support for parallel computing and a redesigned and simplified interface for solving variational problems.
UFL 1.0-beta is now released. Together with the rest of FEniCS, UFL is approaching the milestone 1.0 release.
The changelog for this version is:

1.0-beta [2011-07-08]
- Add script ufl-version
- Added syntax for associating an arbitrary domain data object with a measure:
dss = ds[boundaries]; M = f*dss(1) + g*dss(2)
- Added new operators elem_mult, elem_div, elem_pow and elem_op for
elementwise application of scalar operators to tensors of equal shape
- Added condition operators And(lhs,rhs) and Or(lhs,rhs) and Not(cond)
- Fixed support for symmetries in subelements of a mixed element
- Add support for specifying derivatives of coefficients to derivative()

item.title: fenics: Mac OS X and Windows binaries updated

description.p: The Mac OS X and Windows binaries have been updated and now features DOLFIN 0.9.11, FFC 0.9.10, Instant 0.9.10, UFC 2.0.1 and UFL 0.9.1. They are available from the installation page at http://<wbr></wbr>www.fenicsproje<wbr></wbr>ct.org.
A new version of Instant has been released. This version permits the SWIG executable to be set.
A new version of UFL has been released. The release provides some new features, and a range of behind-the-scenes improvements. A list of changes can be found the in ChangeLog.
